"Unacceptable," the father-in-law commented.

"Exactly..."

At this moment, the mother-in-law suddenly stopped speaking because she saw Zhou Ze walking down from upstairs. Zhou Ze's eyes were red, and he had severe dark circles.

The atmosphere became somewhat stagnant.

Perhaps because of last night's events, Zhou Ze's status as a live-in son-in-law in this household had improved somewhat. At least, at this moment, the father-in-law and mother-in-law didn't say anything to provoke him.

Of course, it was also because Zhou Ze, in his current state, looked like someone who might grab a knife and start slashing at any moment.

His gaze swept across the dining table.

Zhou Ze reached out and covered his chest.

The smell of rice,

The smell of meat,

Was so disgusting.

He felt like he was going to vomit again.

Zhou Ze walked out of the house, breathing in the slightly cool, fresh air outside, feeling a bit better.

His head was a little fuzzy. Zhou Ze began to wander the streets alone. He needed to think about some things quietly, but his current state of extreme sleepiness yet inability to sleep made it difficult for him to truly calm down.

It was a struggle,

And it was uncomfortable,

Like walking out of an internet cafe after staying up all night for two days, or like a middle school student who read novels under the covers all night and had to go to class the next morning.

As he walked, Zhou Ze suddenly stopped. The surroundings were somewhat familiar.

Then he saw the sign ahead.

Tongcheng First Affiliated Hospital.

He had actually walked all the way to his old workplace. Ha, perhaps it was because Tongcheng was too small.

Zhou Ze walked into the hospital, not for a sentimental journey, but intending to get some sleeping pills to try.

He could bear not eating, drinking more water and feeling full would suffice temporarily. But not sleeping was a prolonged torment.

The familiar hospital, the familiar working environment, Zhou Ze saw that his photo on the name list album in the emergency department on the ground floor had turned gray-white.

Then he instinctively walked to his original office. His desk had been replaced. A middle-aged doctor with a face full of pockmarks was sitting in his place. He glanced at the nameplate on the desk. His surname was Kang.

He let out a sigh, a little wistful.

Zhou Ze temporarily forgot about getting sleeping pills. Perhaps this "things are no longer the same" emotion temporarily suppressed the torment of his sleepiness, and Zhou Ze began to wander around the hospital.

He was reminiscing about the bits and pieces of his life here,

His work,

His life,

And,

His past,

Or rather, his previous life.

"I can't go back, I really can't go back," Zhou Ze thought to himself.

Then, without realizing it, he had walked down the stairs and reached the basement level.

He stood still. As a doctor who had worked here for many years, he knew the layout of this floor.

There were equipment storage rooms, and then, the morgue.

He remembered that he had once lain in the hospital morgue and been made up by the embalmer.

He resumed walking towards the morgue.

Zhou Ze wanted to see the place where he had once lain. This was his own explanation for walking towards it now, but in reality, it was a special feeling, guided by some unseen force, that led him there.

As he walked, Zhou Ze saw the door to the morgue. It had an electronic keypad lock. Coincidentally, Zhou Ze remembered the password. If it were doctors from other departments, they probably wouldn't have any contact with this place. But Zhou Ze used to be in the emergency department. People sent to the emergency room were usually patients with severe injuries, and some might not be saved, so they would be sent here for temporary storage.

In fact, this hospital also served as a morgue for the police department. Bodies of unknown origin or those requiring "processing" would be temporarily stored here. This was common practice in many places. If the local police department lacked facilities or forensic staff, bodies were often kept at the local funeral home or hospital.

He entered the password.

The lock opened directly.

Zhou Ze went inside.

A chill spread through him.

Not the kind of chill that stimulates the skin,

But a special, chilling cold that seemed to extinguish the warmth within.

In the morgue, there were of course bodies lying there. This was a temporary resting place for the deceased.

Logically, there should have been an administrator stationed outside. But for some reason, Zhou Ze didn't see anyone when he entered. Perhaps the person had taken a break.

Zhou Ze walked among them. Several bodies were placed on cold gurneys, covered with white sheets. There was also a body wrapped in a common household floral quilt. Judging by the silver hair visible from the head of the deceased, the deceased was likely an elderly grandmother.

Due to his profession, Zhou Ze was not very afraid of bodies. Moreover, he himself was now a ghost.

Zhou Ze walked to the refrigerators. These were the pull-out drawer type.

Refrigerators containing bodies had labels indicating the name, sex, and other information of the deceased.

Zhou Ze pulled open an empty refrigerator, reached inside, closed his eyes, and began to sense it. Gradually, he felt a sense of intoxication, as if only here could he find peace.

After hesitating for a moment, Zhou Ze lay down inside.

"Creak..."

The refrigerator was slowly pushed shut, sealing the closure.

Quiet,

Cold,

Silent.

Zhou Ze slowly closed his eyelids.

Sleepiness washed over him.

He had finally found the feeling of being able to sleep,

But he couldn't sleep yet.

Because he didn't know,

Who had just stood outside and pushed the refrigerator in for him...

***
¹ A colloquial saying, often implying an incestuous relationship or undue familiarity. The original Chinese is vulgar and cannot be directly translated without a footnote.

title: 第九章 你竟然是這樣子的徐樂！
content:
Zhou Ze’s legs began to push outwards from the inside, trying to get out, but the sound of “click, click” came from outside, meaning the lock on the outside of the ice coffin had been fastened.

Locked in, unable to get out.

For a moment, Zhou Ze felt as if he had returned to the scene when he was first placed in the cramped coffin.

However, this time, Zhou Ze wasn't frantic or angry. He simply reached out and tapped on the metal plate at his head:

"Something up?"

Zhou Ze didn't believe anyone had come to push the ice coffin in and then lock it, unless that person was a mentally deranged lunatic, and Zhou Ze didn't think his luck was that bad.

Besides,

When he entered the morgue, he had closed the door. A lunatic who knew the morgue's door code?

Do you believe it?

Therefore, Zhou Ze could only assume that "that thing" had "helped" him, and helped him thoroughly.

However, after this inquiry, there was still silence outside.

Zhou Ze decided to ignore it and closed his eyes again, preparing to get a good night's sleep.

He fell asleep very quickly.

After all, he hadn't slept for two days, and there had been many things happening during those two days, accumulating a terrifying amount of fatigue.

Even if the floods rage after my death,

No one can stop me from sleeping now.

…

He didn't know how long he slept. When Zhou Ze opened his eyes, he felt refreshed and regained his long-lost vigor, but unfortunately, his body was also frozen stiff.

The stiffness of his body was somewhat terrifying. Zhou Ze wriggled his body a few times in the narrow space, and a series of "crisp cracking" sounds came out, so comfortable that he subconsciously made a sound.

At this moment, Zhou Ze’s fingernails naturally grew longer and turned black, shimmering with an unusual luster. The stiffness in his body and the cold air within him, which would be unbearable for ordinary people, were slowly gathering towards his fingertips.

The entire process did not take long, but it made Zhou Ze no longer feel cold or uncomfortable.

He instinctively kicked again, and the ice coffin naturally slid out.

The lock,

Was it unlocked?

Zhou Ze was somewhat surprised. He sat up from the steel plate, got down, and then pushed it back.

His clothes were a bit stiff, hanging on him like cardboard, giving him a very uncomfortable feeling. Zhou Ze’s gaze swept around.

The morgue of the affiliated hospital wasn't very large. Compared to the large hospitals in big cities, it even seemed a bit shy, but it still stored quite a few corpses.

Zhou Ze didn't know who had helped him push it in earlier, and now it was indeed difficult to find them.

Fortunately, since the other party had unlocked it while he was asleep, Zhou Ze decided not to stir up more trouble here.

He walked towards the morgue door, intending to leave. However, as he passed by those beds covered with white cloth, Zhou Ze stopped.

Those corpses covered with white cloth were nothing unusual.

Even the old woman wrapped in a floral quilt from home seemed unchanged.

But Zhou Ze still stopped,

Because he remembered that the old woman's head and feet were in reversed positions.

It was impossible for the morgue attendant to run in while he was sleeping, do nothing else, and then flip the old woman around.

Zhou Ze stopped beside the old woman and said:

"If it's you, if you don't come out now, I'm leaving."

The old woman pushing him in and locking him might have had malicious intent, but she silently helped him unlock it, which meant she didn't want to harm him.

Perhaps someone was about to arrive, and seeing a locked compartment, they might discover him.

After all, whether these compartments were locked or not was very obvious from the outside.

After waiting for half a minute with no abnormality, Zhou Ze decided not to wait any longer.

Just as he was about to turn and leave, a sigh came from behind him.

Zhou Ze found this feeling annoying.

Hesitant,

Playing hard to get,

Clearly an old woman when she died, yet she had to act like a young maiden.

Alright, age discrimination is indeed wrong, but normal people always have a slightly higher tolerance for pretty ghosts, which is only natural.

If Nie Xiaoqian had a face full of wrinkles and big yellow teeth, do you think Ning Caichen would still fall in love with her?

Zhou Ze turned around and looked behind him.

An old woman with silver hair was squatting there, holding a faded handkerchief and wiping away tears.

But ghosts have no tears, so to Zhou Ze, the old woman looked more like she was howling in vain.

"You can continue crying, I won't bother you."

Zhou Ze prepared to leave.

He realized that he was ultimately a commoner, and even when looking at ghosts, he had some aesthetic biases.

"Help me, I have money," the old woman suddenly said.

"Mhm," Zhou Ze replied. He was short of money.

Damn Xu Le's Alipay and WeChat combined had less than two hundred yuan, plus the thousand yuan the "murderer" sent back, meaning Zhou Ze's total assets were less than thirteen hundred.

And Zhou Ze's house and savings from his previous life should have been donated to the orphanage. He was essentially penniless.

"My money is in the interlayer of my cabinet, a lacquered yellow old cupboard. There's thirty thousand yuan in it, and also my dowry, jade hairpins, and jade bracelets. I don't know how much they're worth.

I died in a hurry and didn't have time to tell my sons. I'm afraid they won't know."

Zhou Ze nodded, "I'll take a portion."

The old woman showed a struggling expression, but still nodded, "This is only right."

The old woman knew that without an "anomaly" like Zhou Ze to relay the message, her sons might not be able to find the property she left behind at all.

…

After leaving the hospital, Zhou Ze took a taxi directly to Xingdong Town in Tongzhou District. It wasn't far; Tongcheng Airport was located in this town.

Earlier, Zhou Ze had inquired at the hospital's registration desk. The old woman had been sent to the hospital and died after unsuccessful rescue. Her family then abandoned the body at the hospital and left, still owing the hospital medical fees.

About half an hour later, Zhou Ze arrived at the town and found the village according to the old woman's description.

It was a self-built two-story house, with a small brick structure resembling a rural outhouse attached to it.

When Zhou Ze arrived, he saw several workers demolishing the house, specifically the brick structure.

Zhou Ze walked over, offered a cigarette to a master worker, and asked, "The New Year is coming, and you're still busy?"

"Make more money as the New Year approaches, we're all from the same village anyway." The bricklayer master was quite carefree.

"What's going on with this house?" Zhou Ze asked while looking inside. Two workers were already removing the roof, and the bricks of the small house's walls would be dismantled and reused later. Inside the house, let alone the lacquered yellow cabinet the old woman mentioned, there wasn't even a small stool, it was completely empty.

"His old mother died. This house used to be where his old mother lived alone. Now they plan to demolish it and build a kitchen," the master worker said, leaning his head over for Zhou Ze to help light his cigarette, smiling a bit reservedly. "See, the one who just walked by in front of the house is their eldest son."

Zhou Ze looked over and saw that the man, whose hair was also turning white, had some bruises on his face.

"There are five brothers. They started fighting over the money their old mother left behind. These bricks will be unloaded soon, and the other four will come to divide them.

Tell me, this world, it's changed. Their old mother's body is still at the hospital waiting to be collected, yet none of the brothers are willing to pay back the medical fees."

"What about the things in the old woman's house?" Zhou Ze was concerned about this. From the old woman's description, the thirty thousand yuan in the cabinet was her life's savings, but those jade bracelets and jade hairpins were the truly valuable items. Selling them would likely fetch a few hundred thousand yuan.

"Sold them to the scrap dealer. They were cleared out long ago. They were sold when the old woman was first hospitalized," the master worker said, taking another strong puff of his cigarette. "I'm going back to work."

Zhou Ze licked his lips with a wry smile. This trip was a waste of time.

The things left by the old woman not only did he not get a share, but even her sons couldn't enjoy them. They could only be cheaply sold to some second-hand furniture dealer.

Zhou Ze was now somewhat vexed. Being short of money was really a big problem, and he was unwilling to use his own abilities to cheat for money. Although it seemed simple and satisfying, the last time he saved a girl, he almost died of pain all night. Who knows what problems would arise if he continued to mess around.

Whether there are gods three feet above one's head, Zhou Ze didn't know.

But if you keep digging three feet down, there will definitely be a hell, because he had been there.

He knew he was not human, and this was the human world. Moreover, the patient who died in front of him, how terrified he was when he cried out "I've been discovered" before his death, Zhou Ze remembered it clearly.

However,

Money,

Zhou Ze wanted to grind the millstone,

But who would pay?

Zhou Ze needed money now. Not to mention getting rid of his "son-in-law" identity,

At least he needed to buy himself an ice chest or a large refrigerator, right?

Otherwise, would he have to run to the hospital morgue every day to mooch off the air conditioning?

Slightly depressed, he lit a cigarette and took a deep drag, feeling very annoyed.

Just then, his phone rang in his pocket. Zhou Ze picked up his phone. It was an unfamiliar number. He answered the call:

"Hello." Zhou Ze.

"Big brother, the goods have arrived safely. When are you coming to inspect them? The police are cracking down hard recently, and it wasn't easy to get this batch of goods in." The person on the other end of the line spoke in a low, cautious voice.

Zhou Ze slowly opened his mouth,

Making no sound.

At the same time,

Xu Le’s image suddenly began to rise in his mind.

title: 第十章 大佬！
content:
Apprehensive, uneasy, yet with a sliver of smugness and confusion – this might best describe Zhou Ze's feelings as he took a taxi to the outskirts of Tongcheng.

He was short on money, desperately short. But he didn’t need vast sums, and even if he did, such wealth would be useless for now.

Because he had died and come back to life, his past entanglements and current troubles required a sum of money to resolve. After that, he would make long-term plans, not indulge in extravagant living.

For example, leaving the Lin family. While Lin Wanqiu was beautiful and refined, he really couldn't be bothered to return to that household. They weren't physically intimate, and he hadn't truly enjoyed anything there. It seemed Xu Le, that good-for-nothing, hadn't enjoyed anything either. Thus, he felt no guilt about saying goodbye.

However, leaving that home meant making preparations. He needed a place to stay, and he had to buy a reasonably good quality freezer. Zhou Ze didn't dare to look for a used freezer on the second-hand market. What if something went wrong and he ended up sleeping inside, only to have it kill him? That would be a huge loss.

Money!

Even as a ghost, he needed money.

But listening to the way the person on the phone earlier spoke to Xu Le made Zhou Ze uneasy again. Xu Le, a seemingly useless live-in son-in-law in modern society, so pathetic that his in-laws walked all over him, so pathetic that he slept in a separate room from his wife. Yet, he was a hidden triad boss?

Okay, the contrast in this scenario was truly stimulating and fit the style of American dramas. Powerful characters always had an ordinary-seeming reality.

Like Spider-Man being a high school student, or Superman being a reporter for a newspaper.

So, how should he handle this situation?

How should he deal with those guys?

Zhou Ze didn't want his current identity to be "tainted," as that would mean endless trouble. The police investigation in the real world was already something Xu Le couldn't easily handle. Not to mention that old man and the faceless woman had shouted about "those who will find and catch you."

It was a bit of a headache, and he was still adjusting, but Zhou Ze had arrived at the abandoned small fertilizer plant.

Two men were squatting at the entrance of the fertilizer plant. One wore a somewhat worn-out military coat, and the other wore a cheap, low-quality suit.

Both men were squatting there, a cigarette in their mouths, exhaling smoke.

Zhou Ze paid the taxi fare and got out. The two men immediately stood up and walked over.

"Our boss is waiting for you," the man in the military coat said in a deep voice.

Zhou Ze nodded and followed the man in the military coat inside. The man in the suit continued to squat there, smoking, as if on watch.

Entering, Zhou Ze saw a plump man with a gold chain and a shaved head sitting on a plastic chair, drinking by himself. Seeing Zhou Ze approach, the fat man immediately stood up.

"Brother Xu, you're finally here."

The fat man was tall, at 1.85 meters, and his gold chain was thick, appearing ostentatious. The gold dust rubbed onto his neck from the chain made him even more so.

"Where's the merchandise?"

Zhou Ze clasped his hands behind his back, his fingers interlaced slightly. There were only three people here, and taking them all down wouldn't be a problem. But what to do with them afterward? Handing them over to the police would expose him, wouldn't it?

Should he execute them himself? "In the name of the moon, I shall destroy you"? That didn't seem right either. With his sensitive identity, killing indiscriminately might lead to a backlash similar to saving people indiscriminately. He wasn't willing to try it lightly.

"Brother Xu is as straightforward as ever!"

The fat man wiped his mouth, then reached out and patted Zhou Ze's shoulder.

Zhou Ze's mouth twitched. He took a deep breath, suppressing the urge to swat away the fat man's greasy, large hand.

"Come, it's here!"

The fat man made an inviting gesture and led Zhou Ze to a small storeroom in the backyard.

Upon entering, Zhou Ze's pupils contracted sharply.

A mountain of merchandise piled high, covered with black oilcloth.

Zhou Ze had never done anything illegal before, but he knew that with so much merchandise, according to the law, he would be shot hundreds of times over. He’d get a stomach ache from all the bullets.

"It's not just Tongcheng, is it?" Zhou Ze really wanted to ask, "Did you guys just rob a warlord from the Golden Triangle?"

"Brother Xu, of course. Tongcheng is too small. This batch of merchandise will eventually use Tongcheng as a springboard and flow into Shanghai," the fat man said, stretching. "This time, let's hurry up and move the merchandise. We'll make a lot of money."

Zhou Ze reached out and touched his forehead, saying with difficulty, "It'll be hard to move it all in a short time, right?"

After all, it wasn't like selling cabbage, where you'd ride a tricycle and shout through a loudspeaker.

"Don't worry about that, Brother Xu. We just need to distribute this batch to our people below. Although the profit isn't as high as selling it ourselves, it's fast, and the sales are guaranteed. Once this batch is done, we'll get another batch," the fat man said dismissively.

Xu Le, oh Xu Le, you've even built a drug trafficking network. You're truly amazing…

Such a big boss was bludgeoned to death by that idiot for three hundred yuan!

"Brother Xu, take a look. How's the quality of this merchandise?"

As the fat man spoke, he lifted the oilcloth.

Then, Zhou Ze's face showed surprise.

Because what he saw wasn't a mountain of drugs, but stacks of books and CDs.

Could they be hidden between the books?

"Brother Xu, thanks to your classmate, this batch of merchandise was easy to get. These CDs are all hot movies still showing in theaters. I even specially copied a few more adult films into them. These pirated books and romance novels are also popular works on the market; plus, there are the twenty sequels to Bai Jie that you specially wrote, totaling two million characters. Many of our contacts have already pre-ordered this batch. We won't have trouble selling them."

"The merchandise you're talking about is all this?" Zhou Ze asked the fat man.

"Yeah?" the fat man blinked. "Just this."

Disappointment,

Great disappointment,

And extreme disappointment.

At the same time, he felt shame.

Xu Le was Xu Le after all. For the sales of these pirated items, he had even continued writing the story of Bai Jie himself.

And he had written two million characters of sequels.

How idle was he…

"How much can I get out of this?" Zhou Ze asked. "I plan to withdraw."

There should be capital invested in a joint venture.

"What? Brother Xu, you plan to withdraw?" the fat man asked, surprised. "We're just waiting to make money now, and you want to withdraw?"

"Yes, this matter doesn't align with my core values. I don't want to do it anymore."

Zhou Ze said very seriously. He didn't want to take any risks, especially before he got his current life sorted out. He didn't want to get involved in any potential whirlpools.

"…" the fat man.

"…" the man in the military coat.

"Brother Xu has high awareness. I admire that. For the initial investment, Brother Xu contributed…"

The fat man held out four fingers and said, "Twenty thousand yuan."

"Twenty thousand it is. Give me the money, and the rest has nothing to do with me," Zhou Ze said, too lazy to haggle. Having twenty thousand yuan would solve his immediate urgent need.

"Alright, I have twenty thousand yuan here," the fat man nodded and went to get the money.

About fifteen minutes later, Zhou Ze, with twenty thousand yuan in his pocket, hailed a ride-hailing car and headed back to the city.

He didn't rush back to the bookstore. Instead, he went to the appliance market and spent over ten thousand yuan on a freezer. This type of freezer was generally used by businesses to store ingredients and meat, and it was considered a relatively high-end model. Zhou Ze didn't begrudge the expense, as he would be sleeping in it from now on. He was afraid of cheap ones causing problems.

The shopkeeper was very enthusiastic and sent a small truck to deliver the freezer directly to Zhou Ze's… bookstore entrance.

After the driver and Zhou Ze moved the freezer into the bookstore, the driver seemed surprised.

"Boss, you need a freezer to run a bookstore?" the driver asked.

Zhou Ze handed him a cigarette. "Business is tough. I plan to do some part-time seafood sales."

The driver took the cigarette and left. After all, the goods had been delivered, and he didn't need to worry about anything else.

There was a small second floor in the bookstore, which Xu Le had originally used to store extra books. After Zhou Ze cleaned it up, he placed the freezer there. Looking at his "new bed," Zhou Ze felt much more at ease.

Coming down from the second floor, Zhou Ze noticed someone in his bookstore. It wasn't a customer, but his "wife."

Dr. Lin was flipping through a magazine. Seeing Zhou Ze come down, she asked with some confusion, "What were you busy with upstairs?"

"Organizing inventory," Zhou Ze replied perfunctorily.

"I'm off work," Dr. Lin said.

"Mm." Off work, but you still won't sleep with me…

"That girl has woken up," Dr. Lin said, looking pointedly at Zhou Ze. "Her father wants to treat our department to dinner at Tongcheng Grand Hotel. You should come too."

"What am I going there for?"

"After the girl woke up, she kept calling for 'Uncle'," Dr. Lin asked Zhou Ze with some curiosity, "Did you know her before?"

"Even when people are unconscious, they can still sense things, right?" Zhou Ze continued to bluff. "When I saved her, she might have been able to feel it."

"Are you going?" Dr. Lin asked.

"No," Zhou Ze shook his head. "I'm not hungry. I have no appetite at all."

Dr. Lin nodded, not pressing further. She seemed ready to leave, but as she reached the bookstore entrance, she stopped. "Are you going home tonight?"

The familiar old question had resurfaced.

If I go home, you still won't sleep with me…

So, Zhou Ze answered decisively:

"I'm not going back. I've been a bit busy lately."

Yes, even though business at the shop had grown as cold as an iced latte.

Dr. Lin hesitated, didn't insist, and took her car keys out of her pocket, preparing to leave.

At that moment,

With a "clang,"

Dr. Lin turned around and saw her "husband" had collapsed onto a bookshelf, sending books scattering all over the floor.

"What's wrong?" Dr. Lin immediately went over to check on Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze felt his vision blurring, his focus becoming difficult. His chest heaved, and his legs felt weak, as if he had stepped on cotton and completely lost his balance.

"Fainted from hunger…"

Zhou Ze replied.

He

hadn't eaten in days.

Five days since the book was published, second place on the new book charts for the same period!

In the supernatural category, except for the monthly ticket list, which we can't be on without being available for purchase, we're number one on all other charts!

Yesterday, daily sales on Qidian were second place! Today, daily sales on Qidian are eleventh place!

As a new book with only 30,000 characters and not yet available for purchase, Long can only say:

Brothers,

You're amazing!
